Package domain

Class ClassRoster

java.lang.Object
domain.ClassRoster
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class ClassRoster extends Object implements Serializable
This class will store the data for a subject, including the name, list of students in it, list of assignments for it, and seating chart.
Author:
william
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • ClassRoster

      public ClassRoster(String courseName, String id)
      This method is the constructor for the classRoster class for the student. It takes the name given and creates new lists to store the seating charts, assignments, and students.
      Parameters:
      courseName - The name of the course

  • Method Details

    • addAssignment

      public Assignment addAssignment(String name)
      This adds a new assignment to the list and returns a pointer to it.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the assignment to be added.
      Returns:
      returns a pointer to the assignment, so that Control can immedietly open it up as the current assignment for editing.

    • addStudent

      public Student addStudent(String name)
      This creates a new student and adds them the student list, and returns a pointer to it.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the new student being added.
      Returns:
      Returns a pointer to the new student object, so that Control can set it as the current student and immediately open up it's info for editing.

    • getAssignment

      public Assignment getAssignment(String assignmentName)
      This returns the assignment associated with the name passed in.
      Parameters:
      assignmentName - the name used to search for an assignment
      Returns:
      the assignment that comes up after searching with the supplied name. returns "null" if does not exist. This case will be handled in a higher layer.

    • getStudent

      public Student getStudent(String studentName)
      This returns the student associated with the name passed in.
      Parameters:
      studentName - the name used to search for a student
      Returns:
      the student that comes up after searching with the supplied name. returns "null" if does not exist. This case will be handled in a higher layer.

    • deleteStudent

      public void deleteStudent(String studentName)
      This removes the specified student from the list.
      Parameters:
      studentName - the name of the student to be deleted.

    • deleteAssignment

      public void deleteAssignment(String assignmentName)
      This deletes the specified assignment from the assignment list
      Parameters:
      studentName - the name of the assignment to be deleted.

    • getStudentList

      public TreeMap getStudentList()
      This returns the TreeMap object containing the list of all students, for display purposes.
      Returns:
      The TreeMap containing the students in this class.

    • getAssignmentList

      public TreeMap getAssignmentList()
      This returns the TreeMap object containing the list of all assignments, for display purposes.
      Returns:
      The TreeMap containing the assignments in this class.
